\subsection{Detailed Description}

{\bfseries {\itshape The actual values of macros and typedefs on this page~\newline
 are platform specific and should N\+OT be relied upon!}}

\subsection{Macro Definition Documentation}
\index{Platform Definitions@{Platform Definitions}!A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+B\+E\+G\+I\+N\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+LS@{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+B\+E\+G\+I\+N\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+LS}}
\index{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+B\+E\+G\+I\+N\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+LS@{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+B\+E\+G\+I\+N\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+LS}!Platform Definitions@{Platform Definitions}}
\subsubsection[{\texorpdfstring{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+B\+E\+G\+I\+N\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+LS}{APR_BEGIN_DECLS}}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}\#define A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+B\+E\+G\+I\+N\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+LS}\hypertarget{group__apr__platform_gaa046c9c51a1af394db3a34dec1972630}{}\label{group__apr__platform_gaa046c9c51a1af394db3a34dec1972630}
A\+PR public A\+PI wrap for C++ compilers. \index{Platform Definitions@{Platform Definitions}!A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+RE@{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+RE}}
\index{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+RE@{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+RE}!Platform Definitions@{Platform Definitions}}
\subsubsection[{\texorpdfstring{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+RE}{APR_DECLARE}}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}\#define A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+RE(
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{}]{type}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)~type}\hypertarget{group__apr__platform_ga51bb2fd47cdff20cd9cb91d82e9b0efa}{}\label{group__apr__platform_ga51bb2fd47cdff20cd9cb91d82e9b0efa}
The public A\+PR functions are declared with \hyperlink{group__apr__platform_ga51bb2fd47cdff20cd9cb91d82e9b0efa}{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E()}, so they may use the most appropriate calling convention. Public A\+PR functions with variable arguments must use \hyperlink{group__apr__platform_gae3c44c6cd5ce0c984cd60de588506872}{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+N\+O\+N\+S\+T\+D()}.

\begin{DoxyRemark}{Remarks}
Both the declaration and implementations must use the same macro.
\end{DoxyRemark}

\begin{DoxyPre}
\hyperlink{group__apr__platform_ga51bb2fd47cdff20cd9cb91d82e9b0efa}{APR\_DECLARE(rettype)} apr\_func(args)
\end{DoxyPre}
 \begin{DoxySeeAlso}{See also}
\hyperlink{group__apr__platform_gae3c44c6cd5ce0c984cd60de588506872}{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+N\+O\+N\+S\+TD} 

\hyperlink{group__apr__platform_ga16a1a3d65c57ce052fffb63190b1cadc}{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+D\+A\+TA} 
\end{DoxySeeAlso}
\begin{DoxyRemark}{Remarks}
Note that when A\+PR compiles the library itself, it passes the symbol -\/\+D\+A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+E\+X\+P\+O\+RT to the compiler on some platforms (e.\+g. Win32) to export public symbols from the dynamic library build.~\newline
The user must define the A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+S\+T\+A\+T\+IC when compiling to target the static A\+PR library on some platforms (e.\+g. Win32.) The public symbols are neither exported nor imported when A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+S\+T\+A\+T\+IC is defined.~\newline
By default, compiling an application and including the A\+PR public headers, without defining A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+S\+T\+A\+T\+IC, will prepare the code to be linked to the dynamic library. 
\end{DoxyRemark}
\index{Platform Definitions@{Platform Definitions}!A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+D\+A\+TA@{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+D\+A\+TA}}
\index{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+D\+A\+TA@{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+D\+A\+TA}!Platform Definitions@{Platform Definitions}}
\subsubsection[{\texorpdfstring{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+D\+A\+TA}{APR_DECLARE_DATA}}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}\#define A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+D\+A\+TA}\hypertarget{group__apr__platform_ga16a1a3d65c57ce052fffb63190b1cadc}{}\label{group__apr__platform_ga16a1a3d65c57ce052fffb63190b1cadc}
The public A\+PR variables are declared with A\+P\+\_\+\+M\+O\+D\+U\+L\+E\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+D\+A\+TA. This assures the appropriate indirection is invoked at compile time. \begin{DoxySeeAlso}{See also}
\hyperlink{group__apr__platform_ga51bb2fd47cdff20cd9cb91d82e9b0efa}{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+RE} 

\hyperlink{group__apr__platform_gae3c44c6cd5ce0c984cd60de588506872}{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+N\+O\+N\+S\+TD} 
\end{DoxySeeAlso}
\begin{DoxyRemark}{Remarks}
Note that the declaration and implementations use different forms, but both must include the macro.
\end{DoxyRemark}

The public A\+PR functions using variable arguments are declared with \hyperlink{group__apr__platform_gae3c44c6cd5ce0c984cd60de588506872}{A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+D\+E\+C\+L\+A\+R\+E\+\_\+\+N\+O\+N\+S\+T\+D()}, as they must follow the C language calling convention. \begin{DoxySeeAlso}{See also}

Thread callbacks from A\+PR functions must be declared with A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+T\+H\+R\+E\+A\+D\+\_\+\+F\+U\+NC, so that they follow the platform\textquotesingle{}s calling convention.
